column4: Hi all, I would like to test drive ubuntu server as a replacement of a windows 2003 server.
What kind of items will I be missing out or will I be able to preserve all functions?
it depends what services you run
I now run AD, dhcp server, terminal server, exchange server, VPN, printing server
there is no AD in linux obivously, but the rest are replaceable
however linux has its own solutions to AD if your replacing all your desktops as well
in linux we would use ftp for filesharing
I understand but my situation would be to change the server not the workstations. Because otherwise they loose word/excel and a custom written accounting program for window$
we have samba support but not the full scale AD so you could still have remote file access
I highly recommend using linux for dhcp dns and mail
and can windows clients access the linux mailserver?
if your using pop3 and smtp (and/or several other protocols)
there are several webmail apps available, but you obivously need a webserver running too
its basicly preinstalled package differences with the *ubuntu. debian, fedora and suse have some major differences though
there is alot more options available on linux, and the different distros will explot this
and how about backups can these be done easily? Block level or dedup?
there is a wide selection of clone/backup tools
ubuntu has great support for new admins
actuall avoid gentoo for a production server at all cost
